result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:33 PM Defendant Nicholas E Halsey in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Nicholas E Halsey. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

11:01 AM Defendant Nicholas E Halsey in court. Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of WI. Attorney Max Bergner appears in person on behalf of the defendant. 
ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Stalking, Felony Intimidation of a Victim, Felony Bail Jumping. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

No victim is present to make a statement.

State requests a $5000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments and requests a lower cash amount as to bond. 

Court makes statements regarding bond.

Matter set for an initial appearance on 05-31-2022 at 1:15 PM.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:20 AM MATTER RECALLED. 

Court states that bond conditions were not set.
Court updates the cash bond on record.
Conditions can be argued at the next court date, due to the oversight by the court.
